00001 #include "index_building.hpp"
00002 #include "invertedindex.hpp"
00003 
00004 namespace aitools {
00005 namespace invertedindex {
00006 
00007 void
00008 build_index(const bfs::path& input_dir, const bfs::path& index_dir)
00009 {
00010         /* (1) Setup your configuration.
00011          */
00012         Configuration config;
00013         config.set_index_directory(index_dir.string());
00014         config.set_input_directory(input_dir.string());
00015         config.set_postlist_sorting(Configuration::DISABLED);
00016         config.set_input_format(Configuration::PSEUDO_INVERTED);
00017         config.set_available_memory(4000);
00018 
00019         /* (2) Create an instance of IndexBuilder. Note that the entry type has to
00020          * be compatible to the format of your inverted files. Otherwise the
00021          * records could not be extracted correctly form your input files.
00022          */
00023         IndexBuilder<IntFloat> builder;
00024 
00025         try
00026         {
00027                 /* (3) Finally build the index.
00028                  * The indexing process indexes all records provided by the internal
00029                  * record source and stores the entire data in a binary format which
00030                  * is optimized for fast retrieval performance.
00031                  */
00032                 builder.build(config);
00033         }
00034         catch (const std::exception& error)
00035         {
00036                 Logging::error(std::string(error.what()));
00037         }
00038 }
00039 
00040 } // namespace invertedindex
00041 } // namespace aitools
